page.title: 10Marldons Apple Pie Festival
page.content: Every year on August Bank Holiday there is a special day in Marldon. A procession starts at the top of the hill and goes all the way to the Jubilee meadow, following a donkey and cart. The cart has a big apple pie in it. On one of the floats is a princess, who is chosen from the top class girls in the school. There are other floats, majorettes, and people dressed up. At the Meadow there are horse and donkey rides and even a rabbit show. A celebrity cuts the Apple Pie, and it is sold. The fair raises money for the village hall. It has been going on for about 100 years. It stopped for a while and then was revived about 20 years ago. It is hoped that enough money will be made to pay for a new hall, as the present wooden hut is not big enough.
